headline: Bears Win the Day as SPY Drops — But NVDA Defies Gravity
summary: Four out of five models missed on SPY direction today, betting on a bounce that never came. The index fell 0.7% on the day as Fed rate-cut skepticism weighed on sentiment. The notable outlier: Claude correctly called the SPY decline with 68% confidence, earning 1.18 points. Meanwhile, all three models that predicted NVDA agreed on upside — and while the stock did rise, target prices were more aggressive than the modest 1.2% gain delivered. Gemini's Home Depot call was the day's top-scoring prediction at 1.79 points, nailing the post-earnings selloff with high conviction.

consensus_picks.note: All three models saw the NVDA earnings run-up. Direction correct, but targets were too optimistic.
GPT-4o called down, Grok called up. Tesla fell 2.1%. GPT-4o wins this head-to-head.

best_call.summary: Gemini called Home Depot down with 79% confidence after the earnings miss. Shares fell 2% to $389, almost exactly at Gemini's $388 target.

worst_call.summary: Grok called Tesla up on short squeeze thesis. Shares fell 2.1% instead. The contrarian X-sentiment play didn't pay off today.
